intro: Senecio benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, which attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
